info.title: WITH API
info.description:
Welcome to the WITH API documentation! 
 If you are completely new to the API, please visit '''link available soon''' for an introduction to the model and basic functionalities. 
 We are still in a development phase, so expect changes. We will keep this documentation updated and this text will include a memo of the latest changes. 
 
 NEW: 
 
 (since v. 0.5) Fixed some issues with ```collection/list``` parameters not being displayed properly. 
 
 (since v. 0.4): We have updated our model to a richer, more flexible one! We kept most of the calls the same, however we simplified a lot of the parameters in requests. Make sure you see the new response schemas as there have been some major changes. For any questions and help to implement our API feel free to contact us! ~ LAST UPDATE(v. 0.51): March 2, 2016
 
 Note for using test calls: Testing calls with path parameters now works! Create a new collection and some records and you can try out calls by pasting the IDs in the forms.

post.summary: General search in external resources and the WITH database.
post.description: Body contains search parameters, response is a JSON array of records that match the search term. Boolean search supports use of AND, OR and NOT operators. Terms seperated without an operator (using a space) are treated as an AND. Use of quotes will perform exact term or phrase searches. For example, ```"Olympian Zeus"``` will search for the exact phrase, whereas ```Olympian Zeus``` will equate to ```Olympian AND Zeus```. For more search options use advanced search.

source.description: Different values can be Europeana, DPLA, DigitalNZ, Rijksmuseum, WITHin, The British Library. Results from WITHin correspond to internal records.

400.description: Bad request (invalid json)

post.description: An extension of the simple search to include filters for search with facets. The values of the filters are NOT preset. To see what filters you can use, you need to check the response from a search without filters. Then you can send another query with some values of all the possible filters. To get a better understanding we suggest you use the inspector console of your favourite browser and observe the network activity while performing a search from the frontend, using different filter values.

source.description: Different values can be Europeana, DPLA, DigitalNZ, Rijksmuseum, WITHin, The British Library. Results from WITHin correspond to internal records.

filters.description: To find information about filters we suggest you check the inspector console of a web browser while performing a faceted search from the frontend.

400.description: Bad request (invalid json)

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The serialization of the response. One of the following:  JSON_UNKNOWN, JSONLD_UNKNOWN, XML_UNKNOWN, JSON_EDM, JSONLD_EDM, XML_EDM, JSONLD_DPLA, JSON_NLA, XML_NLA, JSON_DNZ, XML_DNZ, JSON_YOUTUBE, “UKNOWN”, “all”. If not specified, no content is returned, only basic collection fields.

get.description: Retrieve a JSON with the metadata of the record specified in the path, by its Id. To retrieve the Ids of records in collections, you can use the ```collection/{colId}/list``` call see the ```dbid``` field in the response. Many different serilizations are available for the record's metadata. To select one, or more of them, use the "format" parameter. The different serializations will appear in the "content" field in the record response.

500.description: Internal Server Error (database error)

put.description: Update the metadata of an existing record, specified by its id in the path. You only need to provide the fields you want updated in the record body.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A JSON with the updated metadata

400.description: Bad Request (invalid json)

500.description: Internal Server Error (database error)

parameters.name: directlyAccessedByUserOrGroup
parameters.description: Filters returned collections based on the specified rights for each user in the input array of JSON objects. Each user needs to have direct access rights to this collection and not through a usergroup (organization or project).

parameters.name: recursivelyAccessedByUserOrGroup
parameters.description: This field works like '''directlyAccessedByUserName''' with the difference that access rights can be inherited from a usergroup to which a user recursively belongs to.

parameters.name: creator
parameters.description: Filters returned collections based on the '''ownerId''' field of a collection, ie the Id of the user that created the collection.

parameters.name: isPublic
parameters.description: If true returns only public collections, if false or unspecified this filter remains inactive.

parameters.name: isExhibition
parameters.description: If true returns only exhibitions, if false only collections and if unspecified returns both.

parameters.name: collectionHits
parameters.description: If true returns the total numbers of exhibitions and/or collections this call may return (limited by the count).

get.description: This call returns a list of all the accessible collections (at least read access) to the logged in user. Using the parameter filters, you can narrow down the collections associated with a specific user. All filters are optional. Since this call has many parameters we suggest you go through all descriptions before using it.

500.description: Internal Server Error

parameters.name: direct
parameters.description: If set to true, only collections shared directly (ie not via usergroups) with the logged in user will be shown. Default value is false.

parameters.name: directlyAccessedByUserOrGroup
parameters.description: Filters returned collections based on the specified rights for each user in the input array of JSON objects. Each user needs to have direct access rights to this collection and not through a usergroup (organization or project).

parameters.name: recursivelyAccessedByUserOrGroup
parameters.description: This field works like directlyAccessedByUserName with the difference that access rights can be inherited from a usergroup to which a user recursively belongs to.

parameters.name: isExhibition
parameters.description: If true returns only exhibitions, if false only collections and if unspecified returns both.

parameters.name: collectionHits
parameters.description: If true returns the total numbers of exhibitions and/or collections this call may return (limited by the count).

get.summary: Get a list of collections shared with the user.
get.description: This call returns a list of all the collections that have been shared with the logged in user. This means, the user did not create these collections but has been given access rights to it. The filters are similar to the ```collection/list``` call. Using the parameter filters, you can narrow down the collections associated with a specific user. All filters are optional. Since this call has many parameters we suggest you go through all descriptions before using it.

get.summary: Get a list of your favorite records.
get.description: This will return an array of Ids for all the favorited records of the logged in user.

400.description: Bad Request (user or group cannot be found)

get.description: Retrieves an array with all the users that have access to this collection and their access rights.
get.summary: Retrieve all users that have access to a collection.

403.description: Forbiden (invalid collection id, no read access)

500.description: Internal Server Error (cannot retrieve records from database)

get.description: Retrieves all records from the collection specified in the path and returns an array of record objects. Record metadata can be available in different serializations. The format parameter defines this serialization in the records array field of the JSON response. See ```GET /record/{recordId}```. If the format parameter is empty, only the internal record will be provided in the WITH model.
get.summary: Retrieve all records in a collection.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: One of the following:  JSON_UNKNOWN, JSONLD_UNKNOWN, XML_UNKNOWN, JSON_EDM, JSONLD_EDM, XML_EDM, JSONLD_DPLA, JSON_NLA, XML_NLA, JSON_DNZ, XML_DNZ, JSON_YOUTUBE, “UKNOWN”, “all”. If not specified, no content is returned, only basic collection fields.

403.description: Forbiden (invalid collection id, no read access)

500.description: Internal Server Error (cannot retrieve records from database)

parameters.name: collectionId
parameters.description: Id of the collection or exhibition

post.description: Adds a record to the collection specified in the path, creating a new internal record that containts the specified metadata. You will need to be logged in and have write access or be the owner of the collection in order to add records to it. Note that calls to this path can also be used for exhibitions. Position is a Mandatory field for exhibitions, the default is 0 i.e. the record will be displayed first. IMPORTANT This is the preferred way to create a new record! Different serializations for the new record will be created automatically and can be retrieved with ```GET /record/{recordId}```. You do not need to provide values for all the available fields. Finally, please note that this call will only return a message. To see the collection and the new record, you will need to use ```GET /collection/{collectionId}/list``` and parse the results for a list of the record metadata in the collection and the corresponding record dbids. For individual record metadata, use ```GET /record/{recordId}``` with the dbids retrieved.
post.summary: Create a new record and add it to a collection.

400.description: Bad Request (no position in exhibition, constraint violation)

500.description: Internal Server Error (cannot save to database)

parameters.name: collectionId
parameters.description: Id of the collection or exhibition from which to remove the record

delete.description: Removes the record in the specified position, from a specified collection (path). Note that calls to this path can also be used for exhibitions.
delete.summary: Remove a record from a collection.

parameters.name: recordId
parameters.description: Id of the record to remove.

500.description: Internal Server Error (no or wrong record Id, cannot delete from database, exception error)

parameters.name: collectionId
parameters.description: Internal id of the collection or exhibition

get.description: Returns the metadata of the collection specified in path. Note that calls to this path can also be used for exhibitions.

500.description: Internal Server Error(database error)

post.description: Use this call to change the stored metadata of a collection. Note that calls to this path can also be used for exhibitions.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: New collection/exhibtion metadata. Only provide the fields you wish to be changed!

400.description: Bad Request (null/invalid JSON, duplicate title, wrong JSON fields)

500.description: Internal Server Error (database error)

delete.description: Removes a collection from the database. Records that were created into this collection will also be deleted. Note that calls to this path can also be used for exhibitions.

500.description: Internal Server Error (database error)

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A sample body for test calls.

post.description: This call will create a new collection and store it in the database. Please use with caution as testing with this call will update your current collections!

500.description: Internal Server Error(database error)

parameters.name: adminId
parameters.description: User ID of the group administrator.

post.description: Creates a new group and stores it at the database. Every group should have an administrator. Projects and organizations are different group types, to create one of those see their respective calls.

400.description: Bad Request(invalid json, did not specify group admin, duplicate group name or no name provided)

500.description: Internal Server Error (cannot save to database)

parameters.name: adminId
parameters.description: User ID of the group administrator.

post.description: Creates a new organization and stores it at the database. Projects and generic groups are different group types, to create one of those see their respective calls.

400.description: Bad Request(invalid json, did not specify group admin, duplicate group name or no name provided)

500.description: Internal Server Error (cannot save to database)

parameters.name: adminId
parameters.description: User ID of the group administrator.

post.description: Creates a new project and stores it at the database. Organizations and generic groups are different group types, to create one of those see their respective calls.

400.description: Bad Request(invalid json, did not specify group admin, duplicate group name or no name provided)

500.description: Internal Server Error (cannot save to database)

parameters.name: collectionId
parameters.description: A collection id to check for access rights

get.summary: Find a user or group by name or email.
get.description: Returns a JSON object with metadata for the group that has the specified or email address. This call can be applied to all group types, i.e. organizations and projects. An optional functionality of this call is to check what access rights a group or user has to a collection. Just use the ```collectionId``` parameter. The access rights will be returned as an extra field named ```accessRights``` in the group or user json response.

400.description: Bad Request (no group found)

get.description: Retrieves the specified group's descendant groups in the group hierarchy. See '''/group/addUserOrGroup/{groupId}'''.
Retrieves the specified group's descendant groups in the group hierarchy. See '''/group/addUserOrGroup/{groupId}'''.
Retrieves the specified group's descendant groups in the group hierarchy. See '''/group/addUserOrGroup/{groupId}'''.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: New group metadata. You only need to provide the fields you want to change.

put.description: Changes attributes of an existing group. You only need to provide the fields you want to change. Only the administrator of a group has the right to edit it. This call can be applied to all group types, ie organizations and projects.

400.description: Bad Request (invalid json, duplicate group name or no name provided)

403.description: Forbidden (only group admins can edit groups)

500.description: Internal Server Error (cannot retrieve or save to database)

get.description: Retrieves attributes of a group from the database. This call can be applied to all group types, ie organizations and projects.

500.description: Internal Server Error (cannot retrieve or save to database)

delete.description: Removes a group from the database. Only the group admin can delete the group. This call can be applied to all group types, ie organizations and projects.

403.description: Forbidden (only group admins can edit groups)

500.description: Internal Server Error (cannot edit database)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: User or group ID to add in group

put.summary: Add a user or another group to a group.
put.description: Adds a user or a group to the group with the group ID specified in the path. This call can be applied to all group types, ie organizations and projects. This way you can create a group hierarchy with organizations that belong to projects and different usergroups that belong to organizations.

400.description: Bad Request (wrong user or group id)

403.description: Forbidden (only group admins can edit groups)

500.description: Internal Server Error (cannot retrieve or write to database)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: User ID to remove from this group.

put.summary: Removes a user from a group.
put.description: Removes a user from a group with the group ID specified in the path. This call can be applied to all group types, ie organizations and projects.

500.description: Internal Server Error (cannot retrieve or write to database)

put.description: Request to join the group specified by the ID in the path. The group admin will have to accept your request before you join. This call can be applied to all group types, ie organizations and projects.

500.description: Internal Server Error (cannot retrieve or write to database)

put.description: Leave the group specified by the ID in the path. This call can be applied to all group types, ie organizations and projects.

500.description: Internal Server Error (cannot retrieve or write to database)

parameters.name: collectionId
parameters.description: Internal Id of the collection whose rights you wish to change

post.summary: Change access rights to a collection.
post.description: Changes access rights: "none" (withdraws previously given rights), "read", "write", "own", of a specified user (parameter) for a specifed collection (in path). Only the owner of a collection can use this call (you need to be loged in). Just one of username, email or userId needs to be provided.

parameters.name: collectionId
parameters.description: Internal Id of the collection whose rights you wish to change

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: username of user to give rights to (or take away from)

400.description: Bad Request (no user specified)

500.description: Interal Server Error (read/write database error)

post.description: Upload a new media object (currently only support for images is implemented). You can either upload a file or provide an external url to a file (as a multipart/form-data). You can optionally provide rights for the media, if none are provided the default value will be "UNKNOWN". All metadata for the new media will be automatically extracted. The return object for this call is a list of URLs that return the cached media object and its various thumbnails. You can use the "original" url to create a record with the new media. The media ID is encoded in that url. See the call "media/byUrl", on how to use the url to get the media metadata.

400.description: Bad Request (invalid request)

500.description: Internal Server Error (database error)

get.summary: Get metadata for a media object.
get.description: Returns the metadata for the media object specified by the url (see "media/create").

400.description: Bad Request (invalid request)

500.description: Internal Server Error (database error)

post.description: Creates a new user and stores at the database.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Contains JSON of the user to create

400.description: Bad Request (json object describes all errors)

post.description: Log an user in (create a browser cookie). Some API calls do not take the user as a parameter and you need to be logged in first. You can log in with your google or facebook id. The email parameter can be a username.

200.description: OK (creates login browser cookie, returns user metadata JSON including userID.)

400.description: Bad Request (error status, problem description JSON object)

get.description: Browser cookie is removed, user is logged out (all session information is kept in cookie, nothing is stored on server).
Used when registering a new user, checks if there has been another user with the same email already stored in the database.

400.description: Bad Request (not available)

get.description: Returns the complete entry of a user specified by the id provided in the path.

400.description: Bad Request (user does not exist, exception error)

put.description: Updates the stored info of the user specified by the id provided in the path.

400.description: Bad Request (error status, problem description JSON object)

delete.description: Removes a user from the database. (This call might not function currently at the moment.)

400.description: Bad Request (user does not exist)

get.description: Sends an email to the user provided in the path. The email contains a link to a webpage where the user can provide a new password.

400.description: Bad Request (invalid username or email, could not send email)

404.description: Not Found (user email not found - if user had originally registered with google or facebook account))

post.description: Automatically sends an API key to the stored email address of the logged in user.

400.description: Bad Request (no user logged in, email already sent in past, email exception error)

500.description: Internal Server Error ( could not create API key)

get.summary: Get the profile thumbnail of a user or group.
get.description: Returns the photoId of the thumbnail the user or group use in their profile.

400.description: Bad Request (user or group do not exist)

parameters.name: userOrGroupNameOrEmail
parameters.description: user or group name or email

parameters.name: collectionId
parameters.description: A collection id to check for access rights

get.summary: Find a user or group by name or email.
get.description: Returns a JSON object with metadata for the a group or a user that have the specified user/group name or email address. This call can be applied to all group types, ie organizations and projects. An optional functionality of this call is to check what access rights a group or user has to a collection. Just use the ```collectionId``` parameter. The access rights will be returned as an extra field named ```accessRights``` in the group or user json response.

400.description: Bad Request (no user or group found)

parameters.name: prefix
parameters.description: Optional prefix of user or group name

parameters.name: onlyParents
parameters.description: If true filters results to groups and users that have other subgroups or subusers

get.summary: Find a user or group by name or email.
get.description: This call is mainly used for autocomplete functions. It returns an array of JSON objects that contain users and groups whose names match the prefix, as well a ```category``` field with values "user" or "group". This call can be applied to all group types, ie organizations and projects. The ```onlyParents``` parameter filters results so that only groups or users that contain other groups or users are shown.

User.description: Describes a registered user in the database.

UserEmbedded.description: Short description of registered users that appears under withCreatorInfo in WithResources.

ListUser.description: Describes a registered user in the database.

Group.description: Describes a group, organization or project.

WithResource.description: This is the parent type of the WITH data model. Record and Collection models extend this model.

InternalRecordWithContent.description: An individual record description and metadata. The fields exhibition and position are used only for records in exhibitions. This object schema is used for internal search responses (records stored in the WITH database).

InternalRecord.description: An individual record description and metadata. The fields exhibition and position are used only for records in exhibitions. This object schema is used for internal search responses (records stored in the WITH database).

CollectionInfo.description: Internal collection IDs this object belongs to and the position in these collections.

ExternalCollection.description: Metadata related to external collections an object may belong to.

Usage.description: Information related to the social aspect of WITH.

Provenance.description: Holds provenance metadata about a collected resource.

DescriptiveData.description: Descriptive metadata vary depending on the type of the collected resource. The basic data structures of all the different types are: ```LiteralType, ResourceType, ResourceOrLiteralType```

CollectionDescriptiveData.description: Extends DescriptiveData with fields unique to CollectionObjects.

CulturalDescriptiveData.description: Extends DescriptiveData with fields unique to Cultural Records.

MultiLiteralOrResource.description: Can either be a multiliteral or a resource.

MultiLiteral.description: More than one RDF literal types.

ResourceOrLiteral.description: Either an RDF literal or a resource.

MediaObjectEmbedded.description: Holds metadata for media objects, i.e. images, video, text or audio files that are the basis of records.

MediaObjectExtended.description: The extended media object extends the embedded media object with fields for more technical metadata.

Filters.description: This JSON Array contains details about the different filter values available as well as counts of records for each filter.

Responses.description: This Array contains results from each external source, seperated in respecting objects. Note that the facets field is NOT used in the faceted search. The filters field contains filters seperated for the corresponding source.

Search.description: The search response contains two JSON array objects. Responses contains objects corresponding to each external source queried for the search. Filters contains aggregated filters from all the available sources. Inside the response array objects however, there are filter objects that contain the filters for each individual source.

SampleMediaObjectEmbedded.description: Holds metadata for media objects, i.e. images, video, text or audio files that are the basis of records.

SampleInternalRecord.description: An individual record description and metadata. The fields exhibition and position are used only for records in exhibitions. This object schema is used for internal search responses (records stored in the WITH database).

SampleEUROPEANARecord.description: An individual record description and metadata. The fields exhibition and position are used only for records in exhibitions. This object schema is used for internal search responses (records stored in the WITH database).

SampleMINTRecord.description: An individual record description and metadata. The fields exhibition and position are used only for records in exhibitions. This object schema is used for internal search responses (records stored in the WITH database).

SampleMEDIARecord.description: An individual record description and metadata. The fields exhibition and position are used only for records in exhibitions. This object schema is used for internal search responses (records stored in the WITH database).

SamplePUBLICRecord.description: An individual record description and metadata. The fields exhibition and position are used only for records in exhibitions. This object schema is used for internal search responses (records stored in the WITH database).

SampleExternalCollection.description: Metadata related to external collections an object may belong to.

SampleExternalCollectionNoId.description: Metadata related to external collections an object may belong to.

SampleProvenance.description: Holds provenance metadata about a collected resource.

SampleCollectionDescriptiveData.description: Extends DescriptiveData with fields unique to CollectionObjects.

SampleDescriptiveData.description: Descriptive metadata vary depending on the type of the collected resource. The basic data structures of all the different types are: ```LiteralType, ResourceType, ResourceOrLiteralType```

SampleMultiLiteralOrResource.description: Can either be a multiliteral or a resource.

SampleMultiLiteral.description: More than one RDF literal types.

SampleResourceOrLiteral.description: Either an RDF literal or a resource.
